Reddy writes:
> We would like to have a brief chat with you on Tuesday 8:30 pm PST ( Monday 
> is a holiday for us on the eve of Tamil new year ) about SEDA socket layer 
> and generally about the various tasks and other proceedings.

Tuesday isn't good for me; how about Wednesday 8:30p PT (3:30UTC) instead? 

> - The proposed directory structure is not yet created since we are still 
> in the Anecdote prototyping stage and we do not have any complete package 
> to checkin. I have modified the ant script a bit to suit the present 
> Anecdote structure and activated a cronjob over it. I have also added you 
> and Raymie to the notification mail-ids list so that you would also get 
> the nightly build mails. You could get the nightly build from the 
> location "/home/users/w/wc/wcr-team/NightlyBuilds" as stated in the mail 
> on shell.sourceforge.net. You could use your own logins and do SFTP to 
> access the NightlyBuilds directory. It has read permissions for all.

This looks good; I've been getting the notifications. 

> - I am not sure why the stata labs libraries ( st.ata.* packages) have 
> been checked in as a separate CVS module. Are we planning to upgrade/modify 
> those sources and maintain ourselves. If not, we could just have the built 
> classes in a jar in CVS lib directory as we had done for other third party 
> libraries. Otherwise, if we want to maintain it, then would we require that 
> to be a separate CVS module ? I think it would be better if we have one CVS 
> root module under which everything is put in. Probably, in such cases, we 
> can have a "thiryPartySrc" directory to maintain such sources within our 
> main module "OpenWebCrawler" itself.

I just wanted to get those in somewhere since they were necessary to 
run the Anecdote prototype -- don't yet have any opinion on how they 
should be integrated to the main project, if we use them and/or
rev/extend them.

- Gordon
